Title: Illegal Mining: UNODC begins capacity-building for mining marshals
Summary: Nigeria’s effort to eliminate illegal mining and protect its mineral wealth has gained new momentum . UNODC has launched a specialised capacity-building program by the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC)

Title: Gov Eno proposes N1.30tr people’s budget for 2026
Summary: Gov Eno proposes N1.30tr people’s budget for 2026 . N354.867 billion, or 25 per cent of the total budget, is allocated .

Title: 2004 ATBU Killing: I have never killed or issued directive for killing — Pantami
Summary: Prof. Isa Ali Pantami has denied allegations circulating on social media that linked him to the 2004 killing of ATBU Student, Sunday Achi . Pantami: I have never killed or issued directive for killing — Pantami .

Title: Katsina to expend N14b on water conservation structures project
Summary: Katsina State Government is set to construct water conservation structures worth N14.05 billion in Faskari Local Government Area . Katsina to expend N14b on project .

Title: Guardiola gamble backfires in Man City loss to Leverkusen
Summary: Pep Guardiola's selection gamble backfires as Manchester City suffer 2-0 defeat against Bayer Leverkusen in the Champions League on Tuesday . Under-strength Manchester City suffered a shock 2-1 defeat at the hands of Bayer . The result was a 2-2 aggregate defeat for the champions .

Title: Billionaire Richard Branson’s wife dies at 80
Summary: The couple first met in London in 1976, with the tycoon previously saying he had fallen in love with Templeman at first sight . Branson previously said he had 'falled in love' at the sight of Templeman .

Title: Neymar family takes over Pelé’s brand in $18-million deal
Summary: Neymar family takes over Pelé’s brand in $18-million deal . “We are proud to reach this milestone,” he said . Pelé's name remains “a very strong brand” with immense global value .

Title: Police dismiss viral video of herdsmen attack in Rivers as false
Summary: Police Command wishes to state unequivocally that these claims and reports are entirely false, misleading, and designed to incite panic among the public . The Police Command has dismissed viral video of herdsmen attack in Rivers as false .

Title: UK govt set to unveil tax-raising budget
Summary: UK govt set to unveil tax-raising budget . Labour has struggled to consistently grow the UK economy since returning to power in July 2024 following 14 years of Conservative party rule .

Title: Three die in Gombe road crash
Summary: The Federal Road Safety Corps (FRSC) in Gombe State has confirmed three persons dead in a road crash . The FRSC confirmed the deaths of three persons in a crash on the Gom bebe–Yola Road . The Federal road safety Corps said the crash was caused by a road accident .

Title: NDLEA arrests six, seizes N6.7bn drugs in Lagos
Summary: Operatives of the National Drug Law Enforcement Agency have arrested a suspected drug baron, Onyekachi Nwanagu . They uncovered a large opioid warehouse in the Isolo area of Lagos . Title: Police stop Egungun festival in Lagos community
Summary: Lagos State Police Command has ordered the suspension of an Egungun festival in Oregun area of the state, earlier fixed for Friday and Saturday . The Lagos Police Command also arrested suspects linked to the circulation of posters and social media posts warning residents against free movement in the area during the festival . Title: How to access your pension before retirement
Summary: National Pension Commission’s rules for the Contributory Pension Scheme, Nigerian workers may access part of their retirement savings while still employed, though only under specific conditions . Under the scheme, both employers and employees contribute monthly to a Retirement Savings Account . One such condition applies when a worker loses his job and remains unemployed for at least four months

Title: Abducted Kebbi schoolgirls’ release not a victory – Atiku
Summary: Former Vice President Atiku Abubakar has criticised the Federal Government over the release of abducted schoolgirls in Kebbi State . He said their freedom should not be presented as an achievement but as evidence of Nigeria’s worsening security environment . Title: Father of three abducted Niger schoolchildren dies of heart attack – CAN chairman
Summary: CAN Northern President, Reverend John Hayab, has revealed that a parent died of a heart attack following the abduction of his three children at St Mary’s Catholic School in Niger State .
